column4: you don't need the file extension .sh in Linux. It doesn't mean orchange anything. Makesure you mark the file as executable
if you are SURE you want to remove them and in the way then prepend the command with sudo
then use -rf  to (f)orce it. are the files not part of a package?
I'm not sure - but I don't know how to become sure either. I couldn't find any installed packages in aptitude (which I mainly use)
